references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduces the LDM (Latent Diffusion Model) which is the backbone of the proposed method, Drip, demonstrating its importance as a foundational model for image generation and manipulation.
This is a seminal paper in deep image matting, establishing a strong baseline for comparison and providing context for the advancements made by the Drip method.
This foundational paper in image matting introduces the Poisson matting method, laying the groundwork for many subsequent image matting algorithms and providing a classical approach to the problem.
This work introduces a significant improvement on natural image matting, improving on existing deep learning techniques and contributing to the advancements in matting algorithms.
This paper introduces denoising diffusion probabilistic models (DDPMs), a fundamental concept that underlies many modern generative models and is leveraged in the Drip method for image generation.
